Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • Car
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Driveable, java.lang.Comparable<Car>

    public class Car
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Car>, Driveable
    Class Car implements Comparable and Driveable interfaces. There are 4 fields for a car: make, model, year, and odometerReading. There are EVC and DVC constructors as well as getter and setter methods for all fields. This class also overrides Object's toString() function for formatting a string form a car, the compareTo() function for comparing cars and drive() function for driving a car.

        public Car(java.lang.String make,
           java.lang.String model,
           int year,
           int odometerReading)
        EVC for Car - sets all fields to specified values
        Parameters:
        make - a string containing the make of a car (Ex: Honda)
        model - a string containing the model of a car (Ex: Civic)
        year - an int containing the car's model year
        odometerReading - an int containing the odometer reading for a car

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Car car)
        Compares two cars by year, make, model, then odometer reading
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Car>
        Parameters:
        car - a Car to be compared to
        Returns:
        an int containing the difference between 2 cars, positive (+) if this is greater than car, negative (-) if this less than car, 0 if cars are equal in all compared fields
